intro: Cheiranthus radicatus, commonly known as the common wall pepper, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like cabbages and mustards. The plant typically grows in rocky or calcareous soils and is often found in disturbed or urban environments. It produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in spring, followed by long, slender pods containing several seeds. Cheiranthus radicatus is known for its hardy nature and ability to thrive in harsh conditions.
